trans-unit.source: Density-independent pixels, written as dp (pronounced “dips”), are flexible units that scale to have uniform dimensions on any screen. Material UIs use density-independent pixels to display elements consistently on screens with different densities.
trans-unit.target: 与密度无关的像素 ，记为dp （读作“ dip ”），是可伸缩的单位，可以缩放以在任何屏幕上具有统一的尺寸。 材质UI使用与密度无关的像素来在具有不同密度的屏幕上一致地显示元素。

trans-unit.source: Read full texthttps://material.io/design/layout/pixel-density.html
trans-unit.target: 阅读全文 https://material.io/design/layout/pixel-density.html

trans-unit.source: 1. px - stands for pixels. Pixels are a single dot, point on a screen. Generally in the mobile industry it is measured in ppi (pixels per inch). Screen resolution is directly proportional to ppi, the larger the number of pixels per inch the higher the screen resolution.
trans-unit.target: 1. px-代表像素。 像素是屏幕上的一个点。 通常，在移动行业中，以ppi（每英寸像素）为单位进行测量。 屏幕分辨率与ppi成正比，每英寸的像素数越大，屏幕分辨率越高。

trans-unit.source: 2. dip or dp - an abstract unit that is based on the physical density of the screen. These units are relative to a 160 dpi screen, so one dp is one pixel on a 160 dpi screen. The ratio of dp-to-pixel will change with the screen density, but not necessarily in direct proportion. "Density independence" refers to the uniform display of UI elements on screens with different densities.
trans-unit.target: 2. dip或dp-基于屏幕物理密度的抽象单位。 这些单位是相对于160 dpi屏幕的，因此1 dp是160 dpi屏幕上的一个像素。 dp与像素的比率将随屏幕密度而变化，但不一定成正比。 “密度独立性”是指UI元素在具有不同密度的屏幕上的均匀显示。

trans-unit.source: 3. sp - stands for scalable pixels. Generally sp is used for texts on the UI, and sp preserves the font settings. For example, if a user selected a larger font than 30 sp it will auto scale to appear large according to a user preference.
trans-unit.target: 3. sp-代表可缩放像素。 通常， sp用于UI上的文本，并且sp保留字体设置。 例如，如果用户选择的字体比30 sp大 ，它将根据用户的喜好自动缩放以显示较大的字体。

trans-unit.source: Density independence - Your application achieves “density independence” when it preserves the physical size (from the user’s point of view) of user interface elements when displayed on screens with different densities. (ie) The image should look the same size (not enlarged or shrinked) in different types of screens.
trans-unit.target: 密度独立性 -当您的应用程序以不同的密度显示在屏幕上时，保留用户界面元素的物理尺寸（从用户的角度来看），您的应用程序将达到“密度独立性”。 （即）在不同类型的屏幕中，图像的尺寸应相同（不能放大或缩小）。

trans-unit.source: Density independence refers to the uniform display of UI elements on screens with different densities.
trans-unit.target: 密度独立性是指UI元素在具有不同密度的屏幕上的均匀显示。

trans-unit.source: Scale independent pixels(sp) is the preferred unit for font size. For accessibility purposes, Android allows users to customize their device's font size. Users that have trouble reading text can increase their device's font size. You can normally find this option in the display setting on your phone or tablet under font size. It's often also available through the accessibility settings.
trans-unit.target: 与比例无关的像素（sp）是字体大小的首选单位。 出于可访问性目的，Android允许用户自定义设备的字体大小。 阅读文本时遇到问题的用户可以增加其设备的字体大小。 通常，您可以在手机或平板电脑的显示设置中以字体大小找到此选项。 通常也可以通过辅助功能设置来使用它。

trans-unit.source: Scale-independent Pixels - this is like the dp unit, but it is also scaled by the user's font size preference. It is recommended you use this unit when specifying font sizes, so they will be adjusted for both the screen density and user's preference.
trans-unit.target: 与缩放无关的像素-就像dp单位一样，但是它也通过用户的字体大小首选项进行缩放。 建议您在指定字体大小时使用本机，以便针对屏幕密度和用户喜好进行调整。

trans-unit.source: Screen Size in Android is grouped into categories small, medium, large, extra large, double-extra and triple-extra. Screen density is the amount of pixels within an area (like inch) of the screen. Generally it is measured in dots-per-inch (dpi). Screen density is grouped as low, medium, high and extra high. Resolution is the total number of pixels in the screen.
trans-unit.target: Android 中的 屏幕尺寸分为 small ， medium ， large ， extra large ， double-extra 和 triple-extra 。 屏幕密度是屏幕区域（如英寸）内的像素数量。 通常，它以每英寸点数（dpi）为单位进行测量。 屏幕密度分为低，中，高和超高。 分辨率是屏幕中的像素总数。

trans-unit.source: Screen density = Screen width (or height) in pixels / Screen width (or height) in inches
trans-unit.target: 屏幕密度=屏幕宽度（或高度）（以像素为单位）/屏幕宽度（或高度）（以英寸为单位）

trans-unit.source: A dp is equal to one physical pixel on a screen with a density of 160. To calculate dp:

trans-unit.source: A virtual pixel unit that you should use when defining UI layout, to express layout dimensions or position in a density-independent way. The density-independent pixel is equivalent to one physical pixel on a 160 dpi screen, which is the baseline density assumed by the system for a "medium" density screen. At runtime, the system transparently handles any scaling of the dp units, as necessary, based on the actual density of the screen in use. The conversion of dp units to screen pixels is simple: px = dp * (dpi / 160). For example, on a 240 dpi screen, 1 dp equals 1.5 physical pixels. You should always use dp units when defining your application's UI, to ensure proper display of your UI on screens with different densities.
trans-unit.target: 在定义UI布局时应使用的虚拟像素单位，以与密度无关的方式表示布局尺寸或位置。 与密度无关的像素等效于160 dpi屏幕上的一个物理像素，这是系统为“中”密度屏幕假定的基线密度。 在运行时，系统会根据使用中屏幕的实际密度，根据需要透明地处理dp单位的任何缩放比例。 dp单位到屏幕像素的转换很简单： px = dp * (dpi / 160) 。 例如，在240 dpi屏幕上，1 dp等于1.5物理像素。 定义应用程序的UI时，应始终使用dp单位，以确保在具有不同密度的屏幕上正确显示UI。

trans-unit.source: A virtual pixel unit that you should use when defining UI layout, to express layout dimensions or position in a density-independent way. The density-independent pixel is equivalent to one physical pixel on a 160 dpi screen, which is the baseline density assumed by the system for a "medium" density screen. At runtime, the system transparently handles any scaling of the dp units, as necessary, based on the actual density of the screen in use. The conversion of dp units to screen pixels is simple: px = dp * (dpi / 160). For example, on a 240 dpi screen, 1 dp equals 1.5 physical pixels. You should always use dp units when defining your application's UI, to ensure proper display of your UI on screens with different densities.

trans-unit.source: Density independence

trans-unit.source: Density independent pixel.
trans-unit.target: 密度独立的像素。

trans-unit.source: Density-independent Pixels - An abstract unit that is based on the physical density of the screen. These units are relative to a 160 dpi (dots per inch) screen, on which 1dp is roughly equal to 1px. When running on a higher density screen, the number of pixels used to draw 1dp is scaled up by a factor appropriate for the screen's dpi. Likewise, when on a lower density screen, the number of pixels used for 1dp is scaled down. The ratio of dp-to-pixel will change with the screen density, but not necessarily in direct proportion. Using dp units (instead of px units) is a simple solution to making the view dimensions in your layout resize properly for different screen densities. In other words, it provides consistency for the real-world sizes of your UI elements across different devices.
trans-unit.target: Density-independent Pixels-基于屏幕物理密度的抽象单位。这些单位是相对于160dpi(每英寸点数)屏幕而言的,1dp大致等于1px。当运行在较高密度的屏幕上时,用于绘制1dp的像素数会根据屏幕的dpi按适当的系数放大。同样,当在低密度屏幕上运行时,用于绘制1dp的像素数也会按比例缩小。dp与像素的比例会随着屏幕密度的变化而变化,但不一定成正比。使用 dp 单位(而不是 px 单位)是一个简单的解决方案,它可以让你的布局中的视图尺寸在不同的屏幕密度下正确调整大小。换句话说,它为你的UI元素在不同设备上的实际尺寸提供了一致性。

trans-unit.source: Density-independent Pixels - an abstract unit that is based on the physical density of the screen. These units are relative to a 160 dpi screen, so one dp is one pixel on a 160 dpi screen.
trans-unit.target: Density-independent Pixels-基于屏幕物理密度的抽象单位。这些单位是相对于160dpi的屏幕而言的,所以在160dpi的屏幕上,一个dp就是一个像素。

trans-unit.source: Dots per inch (dpi) is a measure of the sharpness (that is, the density of illuminated points) on a display screen. The dots per inch for a given picture resolution will differ based on the overall screen size since the same number of pixels are being spread out over a different space.
trans-unit.target: 每英寸点数(dpi)是衡量显示器屏幕上的清晰度(即发光点的密度)。在给定的图片分辨率下,每英寸的点数会根据整体屏幕的大小而有所不同,因为同样的像素数被分散在不同的空间里。

trans-unit.target: 下面的例子可能有助于更好地理解。缩放比例是基于120(ldpi)、160(mdpi)、240(hdpi)、320(xhdpi)、480(xxhdpi)和640(xxxhdpi)的水桶大小。Google建议的设计比例为3:4:4:6:6:8:12,为ldpi:mdpi:hdpi:hdpi:xhdpi:xxhdpi。

trans-unit.source: For easy calculation, we can follow the 3:4:6:8 scaling ratio between the four generalized densities. If we create a 36×36 pixel picture for ldpi device, the rest densities pictures size will be 48×48 for mdpi, 72×72 for hdpi, and 96×96 for xhdpi.
trans-unit.target: 为了便于计算，我们可以遵循四个广义密度之间的3：4：6：8缩放比例。 如果我们为ldpi设备创建36×36像素的图片，则其他密度的图片尺寸对于mdpi为48×48，对于hdpi为72×72，对于xhdpi为96×96。

trans-unit.source: Now because a tablet is at baseline density (160 dpi) its physical and density independent pixels sizes are the same, 1280 by 800. The phone on the other hand has a higher pixel density, so it has half as many density independent pixels as physical pixels. So a phone has 400 by 640 density independent pixels. So using a density-independent pixel makes it easier to mentally picture that tablet has much more space than the phone.
trans-unit.target: 现在,由于平板电脑是基线密度(160dpi),所以它的物理像素和独立于密度的像素大小是一样的,1280×800。另一方面,手机的像素密度更高,所以它的密度独立像素是物理像素的一半。所以一部手机有400乘640的密度独立像素。所以使用密度独立像素会让人在心理上更容易想象出平板电脑的空间比手机大很多。

trans-unit.source: Screen Sizes and Densities

trans-unit.source: Screen pixel density and resolution vary depending on the platform. Device-independent pixels and scalable pixels are units that provide a flexible way to accommodate a design across platforms.
trans-unit.target: 屏幕像素密度和分辨率因平台而异。独立于设备的像素和可扩展的像素是一种灵活的单位,它提供了跨平台设计的灵活方式。

trans-unit.source: Screen resolution is measured in terms of number of pixels on the screen. Screen resolution is a commonly-used specification when buying a device, but it's actually not that useful when designing for Android because thinking of screens in terms of pixels ignores the notion of physical size, which for a touch device is really really important.
trans-unit.target: 屏幕分辨率是以屏幕上的像素数来衡量的。在购买设备时,屏幕分辨率是一个常用的规格,但实际上,在设计Android系统时,它的作用并不大,因为用像素来思考屏幕,就忽略了物理尺寸的概念,而物理尺寸对于一款触控设备来说,真的非常重要。

trans-unit.source: See the difference between px, dp and sp on different screen sizes.
trans-unit.target: 在不同的屏幕尺寸上查看 px ， dp 和 sp 之间的区别。

trans-unit.source: Similarly if you have a single app supporting all dimensions, adding xxxhdpi assets increases the app size a lot. But now xxxhdpi phones are common so we have to include xxxhdpi assets atleast for icons in side bar, toolbar and bottom bar. Its better to move to vector images to have a uniform and better quality images for all screen sizes.
trans-unit.target: 同样的,如果你有一个APP支持所有的尺寸,添加xxxhdpi资产会增加很多APP的尺寸。但是现在xxxhdpi手机已经很普遍了,所以我们至少要在侧边栏、工具栏和底栏的图标中加入xxxhdpi资产。最好的办法是改成矢量图片,让所有的屏幕尺寸都有一个统一且质量更好的图片。

trans-unit.source: Similarly, if you have two devices with similar screen size, but different pixel density, say one is 800 by 1280 pixels (320 dpi), and the other is 400 by 640 pixels (160 dpi), we don't need to define totally different layouts for these two devices as we can measure assets in terms of density independent pixel which is same for both devices.
trans-unit.target: 同样的,如果你有两台屏幕尺寸相似,但像素密度不同的设备,比如一台是800×1280像素(320dpi),另一台是400×640像素(160dpi),我们不需要为这两台设备定义完全不同的布局,因为我们可以用独立于像素的密度来衡量资产,这两台设备的像素密度是一样的。

So, at 320 dpi, 1 dp is equal to 2 px.

trans-unit.source: Supporting Multiple Screens
trans-unit.target: 支持多种屏幕

trans-unit.source: Take the example of two screens that are the same size but one has a screen density of 160 dpi (dots per inch, i.e. pixels per inch) and the other is 240 dpi.
trans-unit.target: 以两块尺寸相同的屏幕为例,但其中一块的屏幕密度为160dpi(dots/英寸,即每英寸像素),另一块为240dpi。

trans-unit.source: Taken from here.
trans-unit.target: 取自这里 。

trans-unit.source: The number of pixels represented in one unit of dp will increase as the screen resolution increases (when you have more dots/pixels per inch). Conversely on devices with lower resolution, the number of pixels represented in on unit of dp will decrease. Since this is a relative unit, it needs to have a baseline to be compared with. This baseline is a 160 dpi screen. This is the equation: px = dp * (dpi / 160).
trans-unit.target: 当屏幕分辨率提高时（每英寸有更多点/像素时），以dp为单位表示的像素数将增加。 相反，在分辨率较低的设备上，以dp为单位表示的像素数将减少。 由于这是一个相对单位，因此需要有一个比较基准。 此基准是160 dpi的屏幕。 这是等式： px = dp * (dpi / 160).

trans-unit.source: The number of pixels that fit into an inch is referred to as pixel density. High-density screens have more pixels per inch than low-density ones. As a result, UI elements of the same pixel dimensions appear larger on low-density screens, and smaller on high-density screens.
trans-unit.target: 适合于一英寸的像素数被称为像素密度。高密度的屏幕比低密度的屏幕每英寸的像素数要多。因此,相同像素尺寸的UI元素在低密度的屏幕上看起来更大,而在高密度的屏幕上则更小。

trans-unit.source: The number of pixels that fit into an inch is referred to as pixel density. High-density screens have more pixels per inch than low-density ones....
trans-unit.target: 适合于一英寸的像素数被称为像素密度。高密度的屏幕比低密度的屏幕每英寸的像素数要多。

trans-unit.source: The number of pixels within a physical area of the screen; usually referred to as dpi (dots per inch). For example, a "low" density screen has fewer pixels within a given physical area, compared to a "normal" or "high" density screen. For simplicity, Android groups all actual screen densities into six generalized densities: low, medium, high, extra-high, extra-extra-high, and extra-extra-extra-high.
trans-unit.target: 屏幕的物理区域内的像素数;通常称为DPI(每英寸点数)。例如,与 "普通 "或 "高 "密度屏幕相比,"低 "密度屏幕在一定物理区域内的像素数较少。为了简单起见,Android将所有实际的屏幕密度分为六种通用密度:低密度、中密度、高密度、超高密度、超高密度、超高密度和超高密度。

trans-unit.source: The only problem is that, the android dpi of some screens are not accurate. For example, a screen classified to 160dpi may have 170dpi indeed. So the computation result of dp is fuzzy. It should be approximately the same as 1/160 inch.
trans-unit.target: 唯一的问题是，某些屏幕的android dpi不准确。 例如，分类为160dpi的屏幕可能确实具有170dpi。 因此， dp 的计算结果是模糊的。 它应大约等于 1/160 inch 。

trans-unit.source: The orientation of the screen from the user's point of view. This is either landscape or portrait, meaning that the screen's aspect ratio is either wide or tall, respectively. Be aware that not only do different devices operate in different orientations by default, but the orientation can change at runtime when the user rotates the device.
trans-unit.target: 从用户的角度看,屏幕的方向。可以是横向或纵向,这意味着屏幕的长宽比分别是宽或高。请注意,不同的设备不仅在默认情况下以不同的方向运行,而且在运行时,当用户旋转设备时,方向也会发生变化。

trans-unit.target: 另一种方法是：说，您想向应用程序添加图像，并且需要它来填充 100 * 100 dp 控件。 您需要为支持的屏幕尺寸创建不同尺寸的图像：

trans-unit.source: The quantity of pixels within a physical area of the screen; usually referred to as dpi (dots per inch). For example, a "low" density screen has fewer pixels within a given physical area, compared to a "normal" or "high" density screen. For simplicity, Android groups all actual screen densities into four generalized densities: low, medium, high, and extra high.
trans-unit.target: 屏幕的物理区域内的像素数量;通常称为DPI(每英寸点数)。例如,与 "普通 "或 "高 "密度屏幕相比,"低 "密度屏幕在一定的物理区域内的像素数量较少。为了简单起见,Android将所有实际的屏幕密度分为四种通用密度:低密度、中密度、高密度和超高密度。

trans-unit.source: The same for other densities...
trans-unit.target: 其他的密度也是一样的......

trans-unit.source: The screen of a mobile phone is made up of thousands of tiny dots known as pixels (px). A pixel is the smallest element which goes to make the picture. The more the number of pixels to make a picture or wording, the sharper it becomes and makes the smartphone screen more easily readable.
trans-unit.target: 手机屏幕由数千个称为像素（px）的小点组成。 像素是制作图片的最小元素。 用来制作图片或文字的像素数量越多，它变得越清晰，从而使智能手机屏幕越容易阅读。

trans-unit.source: The total number of physical pixels on a screen. When adding support for multiple screens, applications do not work directly with resolution; applications should be concerned only with screen size and density, as specified by the generalized size and density groups.
trans-unit.target: 指的是屏幕上的物理像素总数。当增加对多屏幕的支持时,应用程序不直接与分辨率有关;应用程序应只关注屏幕的大小和密度,由通用的大小和密度组指定。

trans-unit.source: There is a lot of talk about using "sp" for font sizes, and while I appreciate the point, I don't think that it is the right thing to do from a design point of view. You can end up breaking your design if the user has some wonky font size selection, and the user will end up blaming the app, and not their own life choices.
trans-unit.target: 有很多关于使用“ sp”作为字体大小的讨论，虽然我很欣赏这一点，但从设计的角度来看，我认为这样做是不正确的。 如果用户选择了一些不稳定的字体大小，最终可能会破坏您的设计，而最终用户将责备该应用程序 ，而不是自己的生活选择。

trans-unit.source: These are dimension values defined in XML. A dimension is specified with a number followed by a unit of measure. For example: 10px, 2in, 5sp. The following units of measure are supported by Android:
trans-unit.target: 这些是在XML中定义的维度值。一个维度是用一个数字指定的,后面是一个计量单位。例如:10px,2in,5sp。Android支持以下计量单位。

trans-unit.source: This might be well of course vendor dependent since it lies in packages/apps/Settings.
trans-unit.target: 当然，这可能取决于供应商，因为它位于package / apps / Settings中 。

trans-unit.source: This unit scales according to the screen dpi (similar to dp) as well as the user’s font size preference.
trans-unit.target: 该单位根据屏幕dpi（类似于dp）以及用户的字体大小首选项进行缩放。

trans-unit.source: This will sort out a lot of the confusion when translating between px and dp, if you know your screen dpi.
trans-unit.target: 如果你知道你的屏幕dpi,这将解决很多在px和dp之间翻译时的困惑。

trans-unit.source:
To design an app UI for different screen sizes, our initial design has to meet a minimum required space for each screen size. Android defines a minimum size (in dp) for each generalized screen type. Here is an Android screen size guideline.
When we get the screen size in dp, it is not enough for us to design the Android app UI. For each screen size, we need to prepare graphics and bitmap images for each density. Here is an Android screen density guideline.
trans-unit.target: 要针对不同的屏幕尺寸设计一个App UI,我们的初始设计必须满足每个屏幕尺寸的最小空间要求。Android为每个通用的屏幕类型定义了一个最小尺寸(单位为dp)。下面是Android的屏幕尺寸指南。当我们得到了以dp为单位的屏幕尺寸后,我们在设计Android应用UI的时候,还远远不够。对于每一个屏幕尺寸,我们需要准备好图形和位图图片的密度。下面是安卓屏幕密度指南。

trans-unit.source: To get the same size on different screen densities, Android translates these units into pixels at runtime, so there is no tricky math for you to do.
trans-unit.target: 要想在不同的屏幕密度上得到相同的尺寸,安卓在运行时将这些单位转化为像素,所以没有什么棘手的数学问题需要你去做。

trans-unit.source: Try to get all pixel values in even numbers from the creative team. Otherwise precision lose will happen while multiplying with 0.5.
trans-unit.target: 尽量让创意团队的像素值都是偶数。否则在乘以0.5的时候会发生精度损失。

trans-unit.source: Understanding pixel to dp and vice versa is very essential (especially for giving exact dp values to creative team)
trans-unit.target: 理解像素到DP,反之亦然(特别是给创意团队提供准确的DP值)是非常重要的。

trans-unit.source: Use sp for {text-size} only.
trans-unit.target: 仅将 sp 用于{text-size}。

trans-unit.source: Use dp for everything else.
trans-unit.target: 将dp用于其他所有内容。

trans-unit.source: Use sp for Text size.
trans-unit.target: 使用sp作为文本大小。

trans-unit.source: Use dp except the text font size.
trans-unit.target: 使用DP除文字字体大小。

trans-unit.source: Use sp and dp for text size considering UX.
trans-unit.target: 考虑到用户体验,使用sp和dp的文字大小。

trans-unit.source: Use sp for font sizes. Then only the font inside the application will change while device fonts size changes (that is, Display -> Fonts on Device). If you want to keep a static sized font inside the app, you can give the font dimension in dp. In such a case, it will never change. Developers may get such a requirement for some specific screens, for that, developers can use dp instead of sp. In all other cases, sp is recommended.
trans-unit.target: 使用sp表示字体大小。 然后，当设备字体大小更改时（即，显示->设备上的字体），仅应用程序内的字体会更改。 如果要在应用程序中保留静态大小的字体，可以在dp中指定字体尺寸。 在这种情况下，它将永远不会改变。 开发人员可能对某些特定屏幕有这样的要求，为此，开发人员可以使用dp代替sp。 在所有其他情况下，建议使用sp。

trans-unit.source: Using this 1.5 and 3 pixels knowledge, a software engineer can design layouts for different densities.
trans-unit.target: 利用这些1.5像素和3像素的知识,软件工程师可以设计出不同密度的布局。

trans-unit.source: While the idea of "sp" fonts has a good heart, it is a poor idea. Stick with dp for everything.
trans-unit.target: 虽然 "SP "字体的想法很好,但这是个可怜的想法。坚持用DP做什么都要用DP。

trans-unit.source: With scale independent pixels, 16 sp is exactly the same as 16 dp when the device's font size is normal or 100%. But when device's font size is large, for example 125%, 16 sp will translate to 20 dp or 1.25 times 16.
trans-unit.target: 在比例独立的像素下,当设备的字体大小正常或100%时,16 sp与16 dp完全相同。但当设备的字体大小较大,例如125%时,16 sp将转化为20 dp或1.25倍16。

trans-unit.source: Working with density independent pixels help us to deal with a situation like where you have two devices with same pixel resolution, but differing amount of space. Suppose in a case, a tablet and phone has the same pixel resolution 1280 by 800 pixels (160 dpi) and 800 by 1280 pixels (320 dpi) respectively.
trans-unit.target: 使用密度独立的像素,可以帮助我们处理两种像素分辨率相同,但空间不同的设备。假设在一个案例中,平板电脑和手机的像素分辨率分别为1280×800像素(160dpi)和800×1280像素(320dpi)。
